posts.cooked:
It would be awesome if we could play linked youtube videos inside signal without having to leave the app.

Currently this seems like the only feature im missing from WhatsApp after making the switch.

link_counts.title: Make YouTube links play like a video in stories

posts.cooked: I don‚Äôt think this is a good idea for people who care about privacy on a privacy platform! Many people use NewPipe or Invidious to access YouTube videos privatelly. Playing YouTube videos in the app would connect to YouTube directly and affect privacy!

I believe that, in WhatsApp, the YouTube video is streamed via WhatsApp‚Äôs servers. This is a guess but I assume it‚Äôs the case as watching a YouTube video within WhatsApp doesn‚Äôt make the video show up in your YouTube history.

This is especially useful for me for Facebook videos. I don‚Äôt have a Facebook account but can watch Facebook video links within WhatsApp which is handy. And again proves the idea that the video is streamed via WhatsApp‚Äôs servers.

This of course means extra server load which Signal probably can‚Äôt afford right now.

I hear you but the way it‚Äôs implemented on whatsapp is if you click on the thunbnail it will open the video inside the app and play it locally but you if you click the title, description or URL underneath it will open it externally. I think having both options there satisfies everyone.
I agree with you. I didn‚Äôt disagree. Just explained how it works
Sorry, i was actually replying to @BigBrother
Oh sorry. So you were. I didn‚Äôt realise.

Hi all,

I‚Äôve enjoyed using Signal so far. However, there are a few features that I miss from other messaging apps and I see that some have already been requested by others, some already implemented (thanks to all involved!).

One feature I do use frequently is the ability to watch a video directly from the app, especially picture in picture (PiP) mode. My friends and I share links to videos (e.g. YouTube) a lot and it would be really convenient to discuss about the video when it is being played in PiP mode rather than jumping between Signal and YouTube app.

Cheers.

the_new_mr:

This is a guess but I assume it‚Äôs the case as watching a YouTube video within WhatsApp doesn‚Äôt make the video show up in your YouTube history.

That‚Äôs because WhatsApp doesn‚Äôt have your YouTube / Google login credentials or authorization token.
You can‚Äôt conclude that it‚Äôs relayed over WhatsApp servers. Tbh I highly doubt that WA ais doing it as video streaming consumes a sh*tload of resources that IMO not even WhatsApp has to spare.
Or do you see any advantage WA would gain by acting as a proxy?

Yes I‚Äôm aware WhatsApp don‚Äôt have login credentials or authorisation token. That was my point.

Advantage? A feature for users. I‚Äôm not sure how it‚Äôs implemented. I can only guess without the source code.
This would be especially useful for live events.

That is true, just like how Apple has just launch SharePlay, where we can stream things over FaceTime now.
Similar to Netflix party. I‚Äôm sure there are others I‚Äôm not aware of.

posts.name: null
posts.cooked:
Would be nice if we could play twitter or youtube embedded videos inside the chat screen. I‚Äôm aware it‚Äôs not implemented because it could cause privacy issues, but maybe have it disabled by default and an option that you can enable to allow playback? The app is perfect but not being able to play content inside the app is the only downside.

Thanks

I guess you mean allow embedding media, because currently nothing is embedded ‚Äì previews from YouTube, Twitter, etc are fetched by the sender and included with the message as an image attachment with text.

Personally, I don‚Äôt think there should be any embedded media ‚Äì it just adds more ‚Äúmoving parts‚Äù to maintain and additional attack surfaces, and what do you gain? It‚Äôs already a single tap to open the link in its respective app.

+1 for this feature

I use this quite a lot in both Whatsapp and Apple Messages. I‚Äôm not sure, but I don‚Äôt think those apps actually direct any content from youtube (or whatever) through their servers. It simply detects a video url in the received/composed message and then creates a player for it when rendering the message, while the actual message that gets transmitted only contains the url.

It would be awesome if Signal would implement something like this and ‚Äúcombine‚Äù it with how DuckDuckGo‚Äôs Duck Player allows you to watch youtube videos.

link_counts.title: About Duck Player - DuckDuckGo Help Pages

posts.name: Pickle
posts.cooked: I think this could potentially be a useful feature. I think it‚Äôs important to think about the potential privacy concerns too though. For example, someone sends you a youtube link, you accidentally click play, now Google knows your IP and video you want to watch.
